column4: Greetings chaps. Small problem here with the Ubuntu server - have set up dhcp3-server and configured it properly, along with /etc/network/interfaces. Clients are being issued a dhcp IP.
I've also run my usual iptables firewall script... to allow the clients to access the internet. However the only programme on any of the clients which connects is Skype. Nothing else. Any clues?
check to ensure the script is dfoing what you think it should be doing?
well now, in 3 years on a Debian server it hasn't let me down..
ok, then don't.
sorry, getting swamped here
no no, this is in meatspace
right, perhaps it's time to investigate the iptables.. is there a config or source or soemthing with a vanilla ubuntu server install which I can examine?
you should be able to pick apart the iptables .deb and get the vanilla conf.
GRUB didn't do a runner. the NT bootloader overwrote it without prompting. that's what it does.
a little bit of skullduggery on MS's part. If I re-run the ubuntu installation do you suppose I'll be sorted?
there are different restore methods. this one is straightforward. - http://doc.gwos.org/index.php/Restore_Grub
when i said "that's what it does" i meant exactly that. Windows overwrites the MBR. period.
VPI/VCI?
yep.. found a page on ubuntu for doing a speedtouch 330 adsl modem. All I need now is the VP/VC value - ISP is mum.
they are not in the least universal.
sucks. but you have to get that from the ISP (or someone else who knows how they throw packets around).
short of hunting down one of their techies, I figured if there were a handful of 'usual suspects' it would be worth trying.
how do you get into the exim4 spoon-fed config setup?
you know, when initially installing exim it gives you a bunch of questions to configure it.
i know of what you speak, but haven't futzed with Exim on Ubuntu
*might* be sudo dpkg-reconfigure exim4
so you know, 0,38 is a fairly standard vpi/vci in the UK.
